metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17081 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The gmc_mmx function in libavcodec/x86/mpegvideodsp.c in FFmpeg 2.3 and 3.4does not properly validate widths and heights, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (integer signedness error andout-of-array read) via a crafted MPEG file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17081` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
gst-libav1.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
